Description: Gold finger-ring with stone setting; plain rounded hoop widening slightly at the shoulder; oval cloisson containing a truncated cone-shaped sardonyx setting.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (811)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.119, Tomb 79)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 98, p. 30)
